verses.translation: The Inevitable Hour!
What is the Inevitable Hour?
How do you know what the Inevitable Hour is?
Thamūd and ‘Ād denied the Striking Calamity of the Hour[1].
As for Thamūd, they were destroyed by a dreadful blast.

verses.arabic_text: وَأَمَّا عَادٞ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِرِيحٖ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٖ
verses.translation: And as for ‘Ād, they were destroyed by a furious windstorm[2]

verses.arabic_text: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَيَالٖ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومٗاۖ فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِيهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِيَةٖ
verses.translation: which He unleashed against them for seven successive nights and eight days, so you would see the people lying dead as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
Do you see any trace of them now?

verses.arabic_text: وَجَآءَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَن قَبۡلَهُۥ وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلۡخَاطِئَةِ
verses.translation: Also, Pharaoh and those who came before him, and the overturned cities [of Lot] committed the grave sin,

verses.arabic_text: فَعَصَوۡاْ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ أَخۡذَةٗ رَّابِيَةً
verses.translation: each disobeying the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a severe punishment.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلۡمَآءُ حَمَلۡنَٰكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡجَارِيَةِ
verses.translation: Indeed, when the floodwater overflowed, We carried you [O humans] in the sailing Ark[3],

verses.arabic_text: لِنَجۡعَلَهَا لَكُمۡ تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٞ وَٰعِيَةٞ
verses.translation: so that We might make it a reminder for you, and that attentive ears may take heed.

verses.arabic_text: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ نَفۡخَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ
verses.translation: Then when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast,

verses.arabic_text: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ
verses.translation: and the earth and mountains are lifted up and crushed with a single blow,
on that Day the Inevitable Event will occur.
And the sky will split asunder and will be frail[4] on that day,

verses.arabic_text: وَٱلۡمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرۡجَآئِهَاۚ وَيَحۡمِلُ عَرۡشَ رَبِّكَ فَوۡقَهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ ثَمَٰنِيَةٞ
verses.translation: with the angels on all its sides, and on that Day, eight [mighty angels] will bear the Throne of your Lord above them.

verses.arabic_text: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُعۡرَضُونَ لَا تَخۡفَىٰ مِنكُمۡ خَافِيَةٞ
verses.translation: On that day, you will be brought forth [before Allah], and none of your secrets will remain hidden.

verses.arabic_text: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقۡرَءُواْ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ
verses.translation: As for the one who is given his Record in his right hand, he will say, “Here is my Record, read it!
I was sure that I would meet my reckoning.”
So he will be in a pleasant life,
in a lofty garden,
with clustered fruit within his reach.

verses.arabic_text: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَآ أَسۡلَفۡتُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَيَّامِ ٱلۡخَالِيَةِ
verses.translation: [They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully for what you did[5] in the days gone by.”

verses.arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي لَمۡ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ
verses.translation: As for the one who is given his Record in his left hand, he will say, “Would that I had not been given my Record,
nor had I known anything of my reckoning!
Would that it [i.e., death] had been the end of me[6]!
My wealth has been of no avail to me.
My authority has vanished[7].”
[It will be said,] “Seize him and shackle him,
then make him burn in the Blazing Fire,

verses.arabic_text: ثُمَّ فِي سِلۡسِلَةٖ ذَرۡعُهَا سَبۡعُونَ ذِرَاعٗا فَٱسۡلُكُوهُ
verses.translation: then tie him up with a chain of seventy cubits long.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
verses.translation: For he did not believe in Allah, the Most Great,
nor did he encourage feeding the needy.
So Today he will have no close friend here,
nor any food except the discharge of wounds,
none will eat it except the sinners.”
I swear by what you can see.
and what you cannot see!
Indeed, this is the word of a noble Messenger[8],

verses.arabic_text: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَاعِرٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تُؤۡمِنُونَ
verses.translation: and it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe!

verses.arabic_text: وَلَا بِقَوۡلِ كَاهِنٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer; little do you take heed!
It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
If he had falsely attributed something to Us,
We would have surely seized him by the right hand[9],
then severed his aorta[10],

verses.arabic_text: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ عَنۡهُ حَٰجِزِينَ
verses.translation: and none of you could have rescued him.
This [Qur’an] is indeed a reminder for those who are righteous.
And We surely know that some of you will be deniers,
and it[11] will certainly be a source of regret for the disbelievers.
And this[12] is indeed the absolute truth.
So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
